name: Fresh and Tart Chelada (Mexican Lime and Beer Cocktail)
description: A chelada is a more basic version of the michelada, the chili-spiked Mexican beer cocktail—just fresh lime juice, beer, and a little salt, with none of its cousin's spicy intensity.
recipeIngredient: 2 ounces (60ml) fresh juice from 2 limes (see note), half a juiced lime reserved for the rim
1 (12-ounce; 355ml) can or bottle light Mexican beer, such as Modelo, Pacífico, Tecate, Victoria, or Corona, well chilled

recipeInstructions.text: Pour kosher or sea salt into a small, shallow dish in an even layer. Rub a pint or pilsner glass's rim with the cut side of the reserved juiced lime half, then dip glass into the dish to create a salt rim.

Set glass right side up and fill with lime juice. Add a pinch or two of salt, fill glass with ice, and top with beer. Stir gently if you want to mix it up a bit. Serve with remaining beer, topping up as you drink.
